page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED A FARM WORKER IN WOOTTON ST. LAWRENCE.HE HAS WORKED ON THE FARM FOR THIRTY THREE YEARS, AND THE FARM IS AN ARABLE FARM.THERE ARE FIVE THOUSAND ACRES OF LAND BUT THEY ONLY FARM TWO THOUSAND ACRES OF LAND.TO WORK ON A FARM YOU NEED TO GO TO AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE.IF YOU HAVE BEEN BROUGHT UP ON A FARM YOU DONT NEED TO GO TO AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE BECAUSE YOU WOULD HAVE MORE EXPERIENCE.THE ONLY CHANGES THE FARM WORKER WOULD LIKE IS TO STOP CROP SPAYING BECAUSE IT IS BECOMING A HEALTH HAZARD.ALTHOUGH THE FARM IS AN ARABLE FARM THEY STILL BREED BEEF CATTLE.THE FARM WORKER IS QUITE HAPPY WITH THE MONEY HE EARNS AND IS ALSO VERY HAPPY WITH HIS JOB.
